title: The Financial Toxicity of Universal SGLT2i in HF
text:

Notes: Financial toxicity defined as annual household medical expenditures exceeding 20% of post-subsistence income. ‘Universal SGLT2i’ models the counterfactual cost if all patients were prescribed SGLT2i therapy at full 365-day adherence. ‘Post-IRA’ applies the $2,000 annual pharmacy cap to the Medicare Part D portion of these costs. Confidence Intervals calculated using Korn-Graubard (Beta) method. ‘NC’ indicates variance could not be calculated due to insufficient degrees of freedom.

Notes: ‘Number Needed to Harm’ represents the number of patients treated with Universal SGLT2i to cause one additional case of financial toxicity. ‘Number Needed to Treat’ represents the number of patients who must benefit from the IRA cap to prevent one case of toxicity. ‘Lives Protected’ is the product of the Absolute Risk Reduction and the weighted population size. ‘Negl.’ indicates negligible risk difference (<0.5%).
